name: rescore
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
music
  specialized to change a piece of music so it is suitable for particular instruments or voices: He rescored the second trio, replacing the violins with oboes. The work, which was originally written for three accordions, has been re-scored for strings.
US to check or change the way in which points have been given in an examination or test: Non-teacher scorers will rescore one out of every ten of the essays to check for consistency. After the investigation, the state's testing company agreed with the decision to re-score the exam.
More examplesFewer examplesFirst performed in a chamber version, the mass was eventually rescored for a full orchestra.Some students paid to have their tests rescored by hand.The test needs to be rescored because one section was considered racially insensitive.
